content: Master thesis written under the supervision of Olivier Ley and Francsico Silva. We study elliptic partial differential equations posed on networks. We prove that linear elliptic operators on networks are infinitesimal generators of strongly continuous semigroups. We then consider applications to parabolic PDEs and we also study the Feller property of the semigroup and study its associated stochastic process.
summary: Master thesis written under the supervision of Olivier Ley and Francsico Silva.
title: Elliptic and parabolic partial differential equations on networks and applications

content: Note written under the supervision of Nicolas Seguin for the master’s student seminar on the approximation of solutions of transport equations by neural networks.
summary: Note written under the supervision of [Nicolas Seguin](http://seguin.perso.math.cnrs.fr/) for the master's student seminar on the approximation of solutions of transport equations by neural networks.
title: Réseaux de neurones, approximation et application aux équations de transport linéaires

content: Note on the theory of wavelets. Written under the supervision of Bernard Delyon for a research project in first year of master’s degree.
summary: Note on the theory of wavelets. Written under the supervision of [Bernard Delyon](https://perso.univ-rennes1.fr/bernard.delyon/) for a research project in first year of master's degree.
title: Introduction à la théorie des ondelettes
